casebody.data:
NC NAACP
v.
MOORE, et al. 261P18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 29, 2018 Kimberley Hunter, Attorney at Law, David L. Neal, Attorney at Law, Mary MacLean Asbill, Attorney at Law, Brooks Rainey Pearson, Attorney at Law, Irving Joyner, Attorney at Law, Daryl V. Atkinson, Attorney at Law, Leah J. Kang, Attorney at Law, for NC NAACP. D. Martin Warf, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, Amar Majmundar, Senior Deputy Attorney General, Olga Vysotskaya de Brito, Special Deputy Attorney General, Noah H. Huffstetler, III, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Moore, Tim, et al. Robert F. Orr, Attorney at Law, Asheville, for North Carolina Professors of Constitutional Law.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 27th of August 2018 by North Carolina Professors of Constitutional Law Enrique Armijo, Joseph Blocher, John Charles Boger, Guy-Uriel Charles, Michael Kent Curtis, April G. Dawson, Steve Friedland, Michal J. Gerhardt, Sarah Ludington, William P. Marshall, Gene R. Nichol, Wilson Parker, Jedediah Purdy & Theordore M. Shaw for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 29th of August 2018."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
